Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which NASA scientists manipulated data to make 1998 the hottest year.
Understate: The claim understates the changes in temperature measurement methods and data collection over time.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the accusation that NASA scientists intentionally manipulated data.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the changes in temperature rankings are solely due to data manipulation, without considering other factors such as changes in measurement methods and data collection.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the changes in temperature rankings, such as the shift in temperature measurement times and the evolution of weather station networks.
